description: Born in Kronach as son of a painter.
Work in Vienna.
Appointment as court painter to Wittenberg by the Saxon elector Friedrich III, the Wise.
Award of a heraldic letter in Nuremberg: winged snake with a ruby ring in its mouth.
Stay at the court of Margaret of Austria, governor of the Netherlands, in Mechelen.
Acquisition of two neighboring houses on the Wittenberg market.
Wedding with Barbara Brengbier and birth of her son Hans.
Birth of the son Lucas Cranach the younger.
birth of daughters Ursula, Barbara and Anna Cranach.
Acquisition of the "Cranachhof", Schlossstraße No. 1 in Wittenberg.
Acceptance of the office as council member in Wittenberg.
Preservation of the pharmacist privilege.
Reception of King Christian II of Denmark as guest in his house.
Running a printing office with Christian Döring.
Accompaniment of Frederick III the Wise to the Reichstag in Nuremberg.
Best man at the marriage of Martin Luther and Katharina von Bora.
Work for the new Elector Johann the Steadfast.
Taking office as mayor of Wittenberg.
Temporary loss of his employment as court painter.
Stay in Augsburg and Innsbruck as court painter of Johann Friedrich I. who lived in the EstartDateil.
Start of his work in Weimar.
Lucas Cranach the Elder dies on October 16 in Weimar.
